title: Where to find green small business grants - Small Business UK - http://smallbusiness.co.uk
summary: The article discusses various small business grants available in the UK to support environmental projects, green technologies, and sustainability initiatives. Grants cover a range of categories such as renewable energy, sustainability, energy efficiency, sustainable innovation, and green jobs, with funding provided for a variety of eco-friendly projects.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article describes grants that focus on environmental projects, green technologies, and sustainability initiatives, aligning with the definition of green innovation as it aims to reduce negative environmental externalities and promote sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses grant programs to support businesses in implementing new projects and technologies, which align with the definition of business innovation that involves introducing new or improved products or processes to the market.
green_product: TRUE - The article mentions grants for projects that aim to reduce carbon emissions, promote energy efficiency, install renewable energy systems, and support green initiatives, meeting the criteria of a green product that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE - The article describes grants supporting projects that focus on reducing carbon emissions, enhancing energy efficiency, and implementing sustainable practices, which align with the definition of green processes that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 813312 - Environment, Conservation and Wildlife Organizations; 221119 - Other Electric Power Generation; 561210 - Facilities Support Services; 236220 - Commercial and Institutional Building Construction
greenwashing: FALSE - The article appears to provide accurate and descriptive information about the various grants available for eco-friendly and sustainable projects, without misleading or exaggerating the environmental benefits. It aligns with promoting genuine green initiatives.
